item.title: War coming to Russia, says Zelensky after Moscow drone attack
item.description: Ukraine's president speaks of an inevitable process, hours after buildings were hit in the Russian capital.

item.title: Rishi Sunak to set out energy security plans in Scotland
item.description: The prime minister is expected to announce millions of pounds of funding for a carbon capture project.

item.title: Carer shortage: Woman stuck in hospital for 11 months
item.description: The 96-year-old was one of thousands on waiting lists for carers and says she felt "imprisoned".

item.title: China using families as 'hostages' to quash Uyghur dissent abroad
item.description: Refugees and activists tell the BBC intimidation tactics are tearing apart Uyghur communities overseas.

item.title: Etsy accused of 'destroying' sellers by withholding money
item.description: The online marketplace has come under fire for putting 75% of sellers' takings on hold for 45 days.

item.title: Madonna feels 'lucky to be alive' after health scare
item.description: The 64-year-old spent several days in intensive care while receiving treatment for an infection.

item.title: Theresa May's ex-adviser to run for Matt Hancock's seat in next election
item.description: Nick Timothy resigned as the former PM's joint chief of staff shortly after the 2017 election.

item.title: At least 44 killed in Pakistan after explosion at Islamist political rally
item.description: Police say they have found evidence of a suicide attack at a rally organised by an Islamist party.

item.title: Niger coup: West African leaders threaten military intervention
item.description: West African leaders set a seven-day deadline for the junta to reinstate the ousted president.

item.title: Denmark considers banning protests burning Quran and other religious texts
item.description: The Danish government is exploring banning protests destroying holy texts over security concerns.

item.title: Midwife sacked for claiming terrorists could poison baby milk
item.description: Anna Semenenko was struck off after a panel found her to be "unsafe and ineffective".

item.title: Six killed at Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon
item.description: Deadly clashes broke out between rival factions in Ein el-Hilweh refugee camp over the weekend.

item.title: Tommy Fury v KSI: Boxer to face off against YouTuber in Manchester in October
item.description: Boxer Tommy Fury will face YouTuber KSI in a bout at Manchester's AO Arena on 14 October.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Putin 'peace bombshell' and North Sea licences
item.description: A range of stories appear on Monday's front pages, including reaction to a drone attack in Moscow.

item.title: Europe weather: How heatwaves could forever change summer holidays abroad
item.description: Will the European heatwave and wildfires spell the end of British holidays to hot places?

item.title: Felix Klieser: The problem-solving French horn player of the BBC Proms
item.description: Born without arms, French horn player Felix Klieser uses his feet to plays.

item.title: Schizophrenic killer Adam Merritt's sister reveals she has forgiven him
item.description: The sister of schizophrenic Adam Merritt, who killed their father, believes her brother was let down.

item.title: Sudan conflict: Women tell BBC horror stories of rape
item.description: Women give the BBC harrowing accounts of rape by fighters, as conflict rages in the country.

item.title: The return of cargo-carrying sail ships
item.description: As concerns about climate change continue wind-powered shipping is making a comeback.

item.title: Heatwave: How hot is too hot for the human body?
item.description: James Gallagher spends the day in the heat lab to see what summer heatwaves do to the body.

item.title: Europe fires: The Canadair water bombers battling Mediterranean blazes
item.description: The distinctive yellow planes and their pilots play a crucial role in rugged Mediterranean regions.

item.title: WeChat: Why does Elon Musk want X to emulate China's everything-app?
item.description: Musk is an admirer of Chinese mega-app WeChat, which combines messaging, social media, finances, dating, and more.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: 'Nouhaila Benzina is a role model to us'
item.description: Morocco defender Nouhaila Benzina becomes the first player to wear a hijab at a Women's World Cup.

item.title: Latest rail strike hits - will there be more?
item.description: Members of the Aslef train drivers union are starting another week-long overtime ban on Monday.

item.title: 'The cost of living started my shoplifting': Why stealing goods is on the rise
item.description: With shoplifting on the rise, we speak to some people about why they do it and others about their experiences facing it.

item.title: The Ashes 2023: Stuart Broad retires as the ultimate competitor
item.description: Few England cricketers have created memorable moments, fed off the crowd or enjoyed the battle like the retiring Stuart Broad, writes Stephan Shemilt.

item.title: The Texas town caught in the middle of America's border battle
item.description: Eagle Pass is the front line in a showdown over migrants between Texas and the federal government.

item.title: Stuart Broad: Chris Broad, Alastair Cook & Michael Vaughan on England's retiring bowler
item.description: Nottingham Forest fan, wannabe rapper and terrible golf chipper, this is Stuart Broad by those who know him best.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: PM's pro-car pledge and 'EU holiday chaos'
item.description: Many of Sunday's papers focus on prime minister Rishi Sunak's green policies.

item.title: Stack Rock Fort: Victorian island reclaimed by nature
item.description: A rare glimpse inside a 19th Century island structure disturbed only by gulls and creeping weeds.

item.title: Child abuse survivor who saw grandfather jailed speaks out - as recorded cases hit new high
item.description: As recorded cases of sexual abuse hit a new high, Poppy tells how she helped jail her grandfather.

item.title: Ulez: What is it and why is its expansion controversial?
item.description: What is London's Ultra Low Emission Zone and why is its expansion being discussed?

item.title: Ada Nield Chew: The factory girl who fought for women’s rights
item.description: Campaigners hope to remember forgotten tailor Ada Nield Chew by building a statue of her in Crewe.

item.title: Canada wildfire: Firefighter dies tackling British Columbia blaze
item.description: An evacuation order is in place for towns near the US border as fires there swirl out of control.

item.title: Stormzy and HSBC fund more black Cambridge students
item.description: Cambridge University says the "Stormzy effect" has increased applications from UK black students.

item.title: Belgian Grand Prix: Max Verstappen extends title lead with eighth straight victory
item.description: Max Verstappen was in imperious form as he came from sixth on the grid to win the Belgian Grand Prix.

item.title: HS2: Rail link rated 'unachievable' by infrastructure watchdog
item.description: An infrastructure watchdog gives the project a "red" warning, raising issues over budgets and schedules.

item.title: Watch: Farmer plants massive sunflower field in surprise gift for wife
item.description: Farmer Lee Wilson says he secretly planted 80 acres of the flowers as a 50th anniversary gift.

item.title: Paris 2024: Tom Daley to return to diving after two-year break
item.description: Tom Daley will return to diving after a two-year break and bid for a place at Paris 2024.

item.title: Search over after reports person swept off rocks
item.description: A sea search was launched after reports that someone was swept off rocks while fishing.

item.title: Watch: Injured horse flown to California hospital
item.description: Obe, a 25-year-old horse, slipped and fell in southern California where firefighters came to his rescue.

item.title: Moss Side shooting: £50,000 reward for information after girls shot
item.description: Police renew an appeal for information after two girls, aged 13 and 16, were shot at a party.

item.title: Twitter restores Kanye West's account after ban
item.description: The US rapper was accused of violating the rules on the social media platform now known as X.

item.title: Haiti: US nurse and child kidnapped, says charity
item.description: The US State Department is aware of reports and is in 'regular contact' with Haitian authorities.

item.title: Judge dismisses Donald Trump's 'Big Lie' lawsuit against CNN
item.description: Mr Trump alleged that the US cable network's use of the phrase likened him to Adolf Hitler.

item.title: Terence Crawford beats Errol Spence Jr to win undisputed welterweight title
item.description: Terence Crawford dismantles Errol Spence Jr to become the four-belt era's first undisputed welterweight champion in Las Vegas.

item.title: KyivPride: Thousands march in Ukraine Pride in Liverpool
item.description: The city is continuing the relationship built by hosting Eurovision earlier this year.

item.title: Ex-paratrooper Chris Lewis finishes six-year walk around UK
item.description: Chris Lewis clocked up 19,000 miles, fell in love, got engaged and had a child during his trek.

item.title: Taylor Swift Seattle concert generates seismic activity
item.description: The activity equivalent to a 2.3 Magnitude quake beats a previous record set by fans celebrating a touchdown.

item.title: Man, 80, dies after falling from 3,000ft mountain on Skye
item.description: Emergency services including a mountain rescue helicopter were sent to Coire a' Bhasteir on Skye.

item.title: Wallsend: Family of woman injured by bus found out on Facebook
item.description: Joan Scott had to have her legs amputated when she became trapped under a bus in Wallsend.

item.title: Ashes 2023: Australia are 'favourites' over England in fifth Test, says Michael Vaughan
item.description: Michael Vaughan says Australia are "slight favourites" to win the fifth Ashes Test, but will there be a Stuart Broad fairytale as the 2023 series concludes?

item.title: Belgian Grand Prix: 'Cheeky' Max Verstappen toys with rivals as third world title looms large
item.description: Max Verstappen is toying with Formula 1 at the moment as he canters towards a third straight drivers' title, writes Andrew Benson.

item.title: Germany 1-2 Colombia: Linda Caicedo wondergoal and 97th-minute winner stun former champions
item.description: Manuela Vanegas scores a 97th-minute winner as Colombia stun Germany 2-1 at the 2023 Fifa Women's World Cup.

item.title: The Ashes: Australia openers frustrate England before rain
item.description: England are frustrated by Australia's strong start to a chase of 384 before rain wipes out half of the fourth day of the final Ashes Test at The Oval.

item.title: Netball World Cup 2023: What have we learned from preliminary stage in South Africa?
item.description: Favourites living up to their billing, empty seats and mid-match interviews - what have we learned from the preliminary stage of the Netball World Cup?

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: Colombia's late winner against Germany - highlights
item.description: Watch the highlights as Colombia score a late goal to win a thrilling Women's World Cup game against Germany.

item.title: Premier League Summer Series: Chelsea beat Fulham to win pre-season tournament
item.description: Chelsea beat Fulham to win the Premier League Summer Series as Aston Villa and Brentford played out an exciting 3-3 draw in Washington.

item.title: Nouhaila Benzina becomes first player to wear hijab at World Cup
item.description: Morocco defender Nouhaila Benzina makes history by becoming the first player to wear a hijab at a World Cup.

item.title: Switzerland 0-0 New Zealand: Fifa Women's World Cup co-hosts eliminated
item.description: Co-hosts New Zealand are knocked out of the Fifa Women's World Cup as Switzerland get the draw they need to advance as Group A winners.

item.title: Keira Walsh injury: How can England replace key midfielder in next World Cup game?
item.description: With key midfielder Keira Walsh ruled out through injury, how might England replace her at the Women's World Cup?

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: Spain excite despite reports of 'boredom'
item.description: Spain have overcome a rebellion and, according to reports, boredom to become one of the first teams to qualify for the last 16 at the Women's World Cup.

item.title: Panama 0-1 Jamaica: Allyson Swaby scores the only goal as Jamaica seal their first ever World cup win
item.description: Jamaica win their first-ever Fifa Women's World Cup match as Allyson Swaby's goal gives them victory over Panama in Perth.

item.title: France 2-1 Brazil: Captain Wendie Renard scores winner in Women's World Cup thriller
item.description: Captain Wendie Renard scores a late headed winner as France beat Brazil in a thrilling Group F game in Brisbane at the 2023 Fifa Women's World Cup.

item.title: Women's World Cup 2023: 'I just hope Keira Walsh still has a chance to shine' - Ellen White column
item.description: It is a relief that Keira Walsh's knee injury is not her ACL but her World Cup is still in the balance, says England's record goalscorer and BBC Sport pundit Ellen White.

item.title: Lionesses: Inside England's Australian base camp at World Cup
item.description: Friendship bracelet making, colouring in and coffee art - just some of the activities which are keeping the Lionesses busy in their home from home in New South Wales.

item.title: Women's World Cup: England captain Millie Bright on her football motivations
item.description: Millie Bright opens up about her experiences with childhood illness, being made England captain and what drives the Lionesses, ahead of Friday's game against Denmark.

item.title: China 1-0 Haiti: Wang Shuang secures China's first win at 2023 Women's World Cup
item.description: China enjoy a first win at the 2023 Women's World Cup as they beat Haiti, despite playing for over an hour with 10 players.

item.title: Keira Walsh injury: England World Cup star leaves pitch on stretcher with knee problem
item.description: England midfielder Keira Walsh was taken off the pitch on a stretcher in the 38th minute during the World Cup match against Denmark.

item.title: Women's World Cup: Steel Roses outkick men in Chinese football
item.description: China's women's national team is a source of pride under a system that lavishes resources on men.

item.title: Fuel cost: How to save petrol and diesel
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
item.description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and what that calculation is used for.

item.title: Universal credit: Parents can claim more of their childcare costs
item.description: Working families on universal credit can claim more of their childcare costs from Wednesday.

item.title: Why inflation is falling but prices are still rising
item.description: We report this percentage every month but here are three things you may not know.

item.title: Cost of living: How can I save money on my food shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: First time home buyers: How much can I borrow?
item.description: With rents rising, more people are crunching the numbers to see if they can afford to buy.

item.title: Cost-of-living payments: Who is getting them and when?
item.description: Low-income households, pensioners and some disabled people will get extra help with energy bills.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Cheaper train tickets: Five ways to save money
item.description: As rail fares increase, we find the ways passengers can keep journeys as cheap as possible.

item.title: What are my rights if my flight is cancelled?
item.description: Strikes and poor weather may cause disruption at airports, but passengers do have rights.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: With interest rates rapidly rising, what do experts say about coping with costs?

item.title: Renting: Three ways to win the race to securing a property
item.description: From being first in the queue to being more flexible, here are some tips on how to get ahead in the rental race.

item.title: Energy price cap: What is it and will bills continue to go down?
item.description: The cap which sets typical household energy bills is expected to drop sharply from July.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: Cost of living tips: How to cut energy and heating costs in your home
item.description: Consumer Affairs Correspondent Colletta Smith has picked out some of the best ways to cut costs in your home.
